title: Chelsea vs Man Utd: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer hints at changes for Stamford Bridge clash
text:
James Garner is set to feature against Chelsea (Picture: Getty)

Manchester United boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer says youngsters Brandon Williams and James Garner will get a chance to impress against Chelsea on Wednesday.

The Red Devils take on Frank Lampard’s men at Stamford Bridge after scraping past Rochdale on penalties in the previous round.

The competition represents both club’s best chance of silverware this term and both managers played strong teams in the previous round.

Given they face each other on Wednesday, it was assumed that we would see the strongest starting XIs of both sides.

Williams impressed in Belgrade (Picture: Getty)

But Solskjaer says he will use the game to give more playing time to Williams and Garner.

Asked if the pair could play in west London, Solskjaer said: ‘I would think so. Jimmy played 10-15 minutes (against Norwich) and was excellent.

‘He calmed us down and made some good decisions when we wanted to see the game out. We have not made a decision on who is going to play, but you will probably see the two of them.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Williams impressed in United’s 1-0 win against Partizan Belgrade last Thursday and won the penalty that Anthony Martial converted in the first half.

Garner made his full debut for the club in Serbia and impressed as a late substitute in United’s 3-1 win against Norwich on Sunday.

The likes of Sergio Romero, Jesse Lingard, Juan Mata and Phil Jones could all feature.
